intro: Bossiaea kiamensis, commonly known as the Kiam Kiam Bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Bossiaea kiamensis is often found in shrublands and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance.
